g.text: The Primärsystem and the ZETA Attestation Service are in the same trust domain.
At the time of client installation, the ZETA Attestation Service computes a
cryptographic hash of the Primärsystem software and extends this hash into a specific
PCR (22 or 23) using TPM2_PCR_Extend. The ZETA Attestation Service reads
and stores the resulting PCR value as a reference measurement or baseline.
At every boot of the Primärsystem, the ZETA Attestation Service measures the Primärsystem
software and extends the resulting hash into the same PCR (22 or 23) using
[ZETA TPM Service has no TPM Attestation Key]
Store AK Handle, AK Public Key
Get TPM Quote for PCRs (4, 5, 7, 10, 11, 22 or 23)
Client Instance Public Keys und die Nonce.
PCR 7: Secure Boot State / Policy, Digest
PCR 22 or 23 (if available) App Data (ID, Version,
"nonce": "<nonce>", // From GET /nonce, for replay protection & binding check
Validate Client Assertion JWT (Signature with Public Key from jwks)
Validate Client Statement JWT (Signature with Public Key from jwks)
2. TPM Quote is valid & from trusted TPM.
Quote was generated for *this specific* Client Key & Nonce.
Check if client_id already exists in DB for
(or potentially based on AK/EK cert if stable)
[Client exists in DB (based on Public Key)]
409 Conflict (Client with this key already registered)
incl. Client Instance Key Thumbprint, Attestation details
- state // Client registered but not yet activated?
